sen.e: Sakuji bugyo is a post held by the hatamoto during the Edo Period.

sen.j: 幕府の造営修繕の管理に掌る役職。
sen.e: The post covered the administration of civil engineering under the bakufu government.

sen.e: Specializing chiefly in woodworks, the sakuji bugyo administered carpenters and other craftsmen in the areas of detailed works, tatami mats and garden plants.

sen.e: Along with fushin bugyo and kofushin bugyo, the three posts were known as the shitasan bugyo (three commissioners, mainly in charge of repair and management).

sen.j: 下役に京都大工頭、大工頭、作事下奉行、畳奉行、細工所頭、勘定役頭取、作事方被官、瓦奉行、植木奉行、作事方庭作などの役があった。
sen.e: Under the bugyo were the Kyoto daikugashira, daikugashira (construction prefect), sakuji shita-bugyo, tatami bugyo (tatami magistrate), saikudokoro gashira (tooling office head), kanjoyaku todori (chief of accounts), kawara bugyo (roof tile magistrate), ueki bugyo (garden magistrate) and sakujikata niwasaku.
